meanings.definition: A small device inserted into the ear to block out noise or water.
meanings.sent1: I wore an earplug to sleep better in a noisy environment.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer used an earplug to keep water out of his ears.
meanings.sent3: The earplug looked like a tiny sponge protecting my ear from loud sounds.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was like an earplug, blocking out all the unnecessary noise around her.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of the earplug made it easy to spot in the dark.

meanings.definition: To insert earplugs into the ears to block out noise.
meanings.sent1: I earplug my ears before going to bed to avoid disturbances.
meanings.sent2: She always earplugs her ears during concerts to protect her hearing.
meanings.sent3: He earplugs his ears so well that he can't even hear his own thoughts!
meanings.sent4: The music enveloped her, but she earplugged herself from the world outside.
meanings.sent5: As the noise grew louder, he quickly earplugged his ears to find peace.
